course_title: MRI Pulse Sequence Construction & Image Contrast

learning_outcomes.description: Create MRI sequences by applying knowledge of magnetic field gradients and RF pulses.
Predict the effect of adjusting sequence parameters on image contrast.
Explain the performance of advanced sequences in producing the desired contrast.
Understand the practical implementation and limitations of imaging sequences.
Recognise and explain image artefacts and suggest approaches for their correction.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 - Introduction: Pulse Sequence Revision.

Module 1 reviews the fundamental concepts of MRI techniques as introduced in MRES7100. Students are required to study the materials on the Blackboard website to familiarise themselves with these concepts.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 - Introduction: Pulse Sequence Revision. Module 1 reviews the fundamental concepts of MRI techniques as introduced in MRES7100. Students are required to study the materials on the Blackboard website to familiarise themselves with these concepts.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 2 - RF Pulses: Function, Design, Calibration.

Module 2 covers the functions of radiofrequency (RF) pulses in MRI sequences. The practical aspects, such as Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) and flip angle calibration, of RF pulses will also be covered.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2 - RF Pulses: Function, Design, Calibration. Module 2 covers the functions of radiofrequency (RF) pulses in MRI sequences. The practical aspects, such as Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) and flip angle calibration, of RF pulses will also be covered.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 3 - Pulsed Gradients: Balancing the Equation.

Module 3 explains the magnetic field gradients and theirs role in slice selection, and phase and frequency encoding. It will also explore the spatial encoding of MRI signals.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3 - Pulsed Gradients: Balancing the Equation. Module 3 explains the magnetic field gradients and theirs role in slice selection, and phase and frequency encoding. It will also explore the spatial encoding of MRI signals.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 4 - Sequence Construction: Contrast Formation and Spatial Encoding.

Module 4 will cover the construction of a conventional gradient-echo and a spin-echo sequence.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 4 - Sequence Construction: Contrast Formation and Spatial Encoding.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 4 - Sequence Construction: Contrast Formation and Spatial Encoding. Module 4 will cover the construction of a conventional gradient-echo and a spin-echo sequence.

Tutorial 1 - Sequence Construction Demonstration.

In this tutorial, we will demonstrate the basic process of constructing a sequence.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 5 - Parallel Imaging

Module 4 covers two parallel imaging techniques: SENSE and GRAPPA. It will also explore their impacts on acquisition time and signal-to-noise ratio (SNR).

learning_activities.topic:
Practical Demonstration: DIXON imaging

This one-hour demonstration will showcase the Dixon sequence for fat imaging on a 3T scanner at the Centre for Advanced Imaging (CAI), UQ. The time for the demonstration session will depend on the availability of the scanner and the radiographer, and this will be communicated to the students during the semester. Students are encouraged to observe the demonstration in person at CAI. Recordings of the demonstration will be uploaded to the Blackboard website. Questions for the mid-semester assignment will be based on this demonstration.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 6 - 3D Imaging. Multi-echoes: Dixon, MEDIC.

This module will cover the difference between 2-D and 3-D imaging sequences, the chemical shift of fat, Dixon's method and multi-echo gradient echo acquisition.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 6 - 3D Imaging.  Multi-echoes: Dixon, MEDIC. This module will cover the difference between 2-D and 3-D imaging sequences, the chemical shift of fat, Dixon's method and multi-echo gradient echo acquisition.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 7 - GRE: Steady State - Hahn, DESS, FISP

This module will address the establishment of steady state in imaging. It will discuss three gradient echo sequences: Spoiled, Balanced, and Refocused. The module will also explore the formation of both Hahn echo and Stimulated echo.
